summary: This bill, the "Protecting Legislators and Survivors of Sexual Assault and Domestic Violence from Doxing and Political Violence Act", aims to protect the personal information of Members of Congress, their families, designated congressional staff, and survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault (defined as "at-risk individuals") from being made public. It defines "covered information" and outlines restrictions on government agencies, data brokers, and other businesses regarding the handling and dissemination of this information. The bill provides for individual redress, includes exceptions for news reporting and public discourse, and emphasizes the protection of at-risk individuals' privacy.
